projectPurpose: To provide a SQL-like interface for querying and analyzing data within Git repositories, making Git data more accessible to users familiar with SQL.
mainFeatures: Supports SQL features: grouping, ordering, aggregation

alternatives.name: Git Command Line Interface
mainFeatures: Search file content and history (git grep)

alternatives.name: AskGit
mainFeatures: Run SQL queries on Git repositories
Treats Git data as relational tables
Integrates with SQL data visualization tools

alternatives.name: gitbase
platforms: Server (Linux, macOS, potentially Windows via Docker)
mainFeatures: Exposes Git repositories as a SQL database
Allows complex SQL queries on Git data

alternatives.name: GitStats
mainFeatures: Reports on commits, contributors, files, and lines of code

alternatives.name: Gitinspector
mainFeatures: Reports on author activity and workload
Supports HTML, JSON, XML, and text output

alternatives.name: GrimoireLab
mainFeatures: Gathers data from multiple development platforms (Git, GitHub, etc.)
Focuses on software development and community analytics

marketPositioning: GQL is positioned as a lightweight, developer-friendly tool that allows users to perform ad-hoc queries and analysis on Git repository data using a familiar SQL syntax, without the overhead of setting up a separate database. It competes with native Git commands by offering a more structured querying approach and with other SQL-on-Git tools by providing direct, on-the-fly execution.
